questions.question: What is the difference between 2D LiDAR and 3D LiDAR?

answers.a: 2D LiDAR measures distance only, while 3D LiDAR measures distance and height
answers.b: 2D LiDAR produces a 2D point cloud, while 3D LiDAR produces a 3D point cloud
answers.c: 2D LiDAR scans a single plane, while 3D LiDAR scans multiple planes
answers.d: 2D LiDAR uses a single laser, while 3D LiDAR uses multiple lasers

explanations.a: Both 2D and 3D LiDAR systems can measure distance and height, but 2D LiDAR systems do not scan multiple planes to obtain height information.
explanations.b: While 2D LiDAR systems do produce a 2D point cloud, 3D LiDAR systems produce a 3D point cloud with both distance and height information.
explanations.c: 2D LiDAR systems scan a single plane to obtain distance measurements, while 3D LiDAR systems scan multiple planes to obtain distance and height measurements, producing a 3D point cloud.
explanations.d: Both 2D and 3D LiDAR systems can use a single laser or multiple lasers, depending on the design of the system.

questions.question: Which of the following factors can affect the accuracy of LiDAR measurements?

explanations.a: While temperature can affect the accuracy of LiDAR measurements, it is not the only factor that can impact accuracy.
explanations.b: While humidity can affect the accuracy of LiDAR measurements, it is not the only factor that can impact accuracy.
explanations.c: While altitude can affect the accuracy of LiDAR measurements, it is not the only factor that can impact accuracy.
explanations.d: Temperature, humidity, and altitude can all affect the speed of light and the atmospheric conditions that affect the propagation of LiDAR signals, which can impact the accuracy of LiDAR measurements.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a common application of LiDAR?

explanations.a: LiDAR is a key technology for autonomous driving and is used for object detection and mapping of the surrounding environment.
explanations.b: LiDAR can be used for agricultural monitoring, such as measuring crop height and density, and identifying crop health and stress.
explanations.c: LiDAR is not commonly used for weather forecasting, although LiDAR-based systems can be used for atmospheric research to measure the distribution of aerosols, clouds, and precipitation.
explanations.d: LiDAR is used for archaeological mapping because it can create high-resolution, three-dimensional maps of terrain and vegetation, allowing archaeologists to identify previously unknown or hidden features without excavation.

questions.question: What is the difference between a single-beam LiDAR and a multi-beam LiDAR?

answers.a: Single-beam LiDAR uses a single laser beam, while multi-beam LiDAR uses multiple laser beams
answers.b: Single-beam LiDAR produces a 2D point cloud, while multi-beam LiDAR produces a 3D point cloud
answers.c: Single-beam LiDAR scans a single point, while multi-beam LiDAR scans multiple points simultaneously
answers.d: Single-beam LiDAR has a narrower field of view than multi-beam LiDAR

explanations.a: Single-beam LiDAR systems use a single laser beam to scan a single point at a time, while multi-beam LiDAR systems use multiple laser beams to scan multiple points simultaneously.
explanations.b: Both single-beam and multi-beam LiDAR systems can produce both 2D and 3D point clouds, depending on the design of the system.
explanations.c: Single-beam LiDAR systems scan a single point at a time, while multi-beam LiDAR systems scan multiple points simultaneously.
explanations.d: The field of view of a LiDAR system depends on the design of the system and is not necessarily related to whether it is a single-beam or multi-beam system.
